sen.j: 歌謡（かよう）とは、音楽性を伴う韻文形式の作品のことをいう。
sen.e: Kayo comprises of works of a poetry form with musical nature.
Kayo refers to works of a poetry form with a musical nature.
sen.cmt: 「comprises」がふさわしくない気がするので、「refers to」に変更しました。
sen.e: Kayo refers to works of a poetry form with a musical nature.

sen.j: 歌詞をその音楽と分けずに言及する言葉であり、朗読する詩歌に対して歌う詩歌を指す言葉である。
sen.e: It is a term that refers to lyrics and its music together, and the term of poetry for singing in contrast with poetry for reciting.
It is a term that refers to lyrics and its music together, and the term of poetry for singing in contrast with poetry for reciting.

sen.j: 民間で歌謡は多く文字として記録されない口頭文学として常に存在した。
sen.e: Kayo was always in the public realm as oral literature that was not recorded in letters.
Kayo was always in the public realm as oral literature that was not recorded in letters.

sen.j: 日本では神楽歌・催馬楽・今様・宴曲・小歌などがある。
sen.e: In Japan, some examples of kayo are Kagurauta, Saibara, Imayo, Enkyoku, and Kouta.

sen.j: 日本の歌謡は、『古事記』『日本書紀』『風土記』や『万葉集』に所載されたものから見ることができる。
sen.e: Japanese kayo are seen among the works in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), "Fudoki" (records of the culture and geography of provinces of Japan) and "Manyoshu" (the oldest anthology of tanka).

sen.j: 『古事記』『日本書紀』の2書にある歌謡は「記紀歌謡」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The kayo in the two books, "Kojiki" and "Nihonshoki", are called 'Kiki kayo'.

sen.j: 中国最古の詩集である『詩経』はもともと歌謡であり、音楽・舞踊をともなっていたことが知られている。
sen.e: The poems in "Shijing", the oldest Chinese poetry book, were originally kayo, and it is known that they were accompanied with music and dance.

sen.j: 前漢の時、民間歌謡を収集する楽府という役所が作られた。
sen.e: During the Former Han Dynasty, a music bureau called Gakufu was set up, where folk kayo were collected.
sen.cmt: 役所は「がくふ」、歌謡は「がふ」
sen.e: During the Former Han Dynasty, a music bureau called Gakufu was set up, where folk kayo were collected.
During the Former Han Dynasty, a music bureau called Gakufu was set up, where folk kayo were collected.

sen.j: 以後、ここで集められた作品、あるいはそれ以後の民間歌謡を「楽府」（がふ）と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: From then on the works collected in this bureau and the later folk kayo came to be called 'Gafu' (yuefu in Chinese) folksongs.
sen.cmt: 楽府の中国語読みは yuefu.
sen.e: From then on the works collected in this bureau and the later folk kayo came to be called 'Gafu' (yuefu in Chinese) folksongs.

sen.j: なお漢詩は歌謡から独立して朗読する文芸となった。
sen.e: Chinese poetry (shi) became the literature for reciting separately from kayo.
Chinese poetry (shi) became the literature for reciting, separately from kayo.
sen.cmt: 他の原稿でも「漢詩（し）」と記載されていましたが、「漢詩」は「し」と読まれるの不明です。
sen.e: Chinese poetry ("Kanshi" in Japanese) became the literature for reciting, separately from kayo.
sen.cmt: Chinese poetry ("Kanshi" in Japanese) としました。

sen.j: 歌と詩の分離は、後漢末、建安 (漢)頃であったと考えられている（建安文学）。
sen.e: The separation of poetry from songs is considered to have occurred during the Jianan period (196-220) at the end of the Later Han Dynasty (Jianan literature).

sen.cmt: 「建安」の訳に年号（196－220）が入っていたので、間違いではないようですが、削除しました。「建安」→「Jianan」
sen.e: The separation of poetry from songs is considered to have occurred during the Jianan period at the end of the Later Han Dynasty (Jianan literature).

sen.j: 唐中葉頃から「詞」と呼ばれる新しい歌謡文芸が生まれた。
sen.e: In the middle of the Tang Dynasty, a new kind of literature of songs and ballads called 'ci' appeared.

sen.j: 詞は宋代に盛行し、宋詞の名がある。
sen.e: Ci prospered during the Song Dynasty, therefore it is called Songci.
Ci prospered during the Song Dynasty, therefore it is called Soshi (Songci in Chinese).
sen.cmt: 宋詞「Songci」を日中併記の「Soshi (Songci in Chinese)」に変更しました。
sen.e: Ci prospered during the Song Dynasty, therefore it is called Soshi (Songci in Chinese).

sen.j: 詞は後には詩と同様、音楽性から独立して朗読されるようになった。
sen.e: Ci later came to be recited separately from music as well as shi (poetry).
Ci, as with shi (poetry), later came to be recited separately from music.
sen.cmt: 「as well as」を使うと、「music as well as shi (poetry)」のような解釈になるので、「as with（～と同様）」を使って書き直しました。
sen.e: Ci, as with shi (poetry), later came to be recited separately from music.

sen.j: 宋代から「曲」と言われる歌謡文芸が興り、元代になって隆盛した（元曲）。
sen.e: Another kind of literature of songs and ballads 'qu' appeared during the Song Dynasty, flourishing in the Yuan Dynasty (yuanqu)
Another kind of literature of songs and ballads 'kyoku (qu in Chinese)' appeared during the Song Dynasty, flourishing in the Yuan Dynasty (genkyoku [yuanqu in Chinese]).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加。曲「qu」を日中併記の「kyoku (qu in Chinese)」に変更しました。元曲「yuanqu」を日中併記「genkyoku [yuanqu in Chinese]」に変更しました。
sen.e: Another kind of literature of songs and ballads 'kyoku (qu in Chinese)' appeared during the Song Dynasty, flourishing in the Yuan Dynasty (genkyoku [yuanqu in Chinese]).

sen.j: 曲は戯曲 (中国)といわれる劇中で使われるものと歌謡だけの散曲があり、形式的には小令と套数という二つのものがある。
sen.e: Qu has works called xiqu (China) that are used in plays and works called sanqu that are composed of only songs and have formally two kinds, xiaoling and taoshu.
sen.cmt: 中国語読みで、小令 xiaoling，套数 taoshu
sen.e: Qu includes gikyoku (xiqu in Chinese)(China) that is used in plays as well as sankyoku (sanqu in Chinese) that is composed of only songs and has two kinds of style, shorei (xiaoling in Chinese) and tosu (taoshu in Chinese).
sen.cmt: 読みにくい部分を修正しました。曲、戯曲 散曲、小令、套数について、中国語読みを日中併記に変更しました。
